Hi Markus,

I wanted to do something similar, so maybe my answers can help =
you.


> 1. For the initial start do I really have  to use a seeds file or =
is 
> there a way to tell heritrix to check the actionfolder when the job i=
s 
> started?

If I'm not missing something, Heritrix checks the action fol=
der every time you start the job (in addition to the periodic checks, of co=
urse)

> 2. What possibilities do I have when the job finished before I can=
 add 
> new seeds to the action dir or if the job finished before it checke=
d the 
> action dir again?

You can tell Heritrix to keep running a job eve=
n though there are no more URLs to crawl. To do that, just set to true the =
setting 'runWhileEmpty' under the 'crawlController' bean. For instance:

<b=
ean id=3D"crawlController" 
   class=3D"org.archive.crawler.framework.Crawl=
Controller">
  <property name=3D"maxToeThreads" value=3D"250" />
  <!-- <pr=
operty name=3D"pauseAtStart" value=3D"true" /> -->
  <property name=3D"runW=
hileEmpty" value=3D"true" />
  <!-- <property name=3D"recorderInBufferBytes=
" value=3D"524288" /> -->
  <!-- <property name=3D"recorderOutBufferBytes" =
value=3D"16384" /> -->
  <!-- <property name=3D"scratchDir" value=3D"scratc=
h" /> -->
 </bean>

I think that's the only thing you need to keep crawling=
 new URLs whenever you add new seeds to the action directory.

Best,

Juan =
Manuel Caicedo
